page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: MR. BURTON - CHAIRMAN OF PACKMOOR SCHOOL GOVERNORS. A PERSONAL VIEW MR. BURTON HAS LIVED IN PACKMOOR FOR FIFTY YEARS. HE DID NOT THINK PACKMOOR HAD CHANGED EXCEPT FOR THE FACT THAT ONCE EVERYONE WAS CLOSELY RELATED TO EACH OTHER. THE MAIN DIFFERENCE NOW IS THAT WHERE A 'CLANNISH' COMMUNITY EXISTED THERE ARE NOW MORE OUTSIDERS. PACKMOOR GETS ITS NAME FROM THE PACK HORSES WHICH WERE ONCE USED TO CARRY GOODS TO AND FROM THE VILLAGE. I THOUGHT IT WAS PERHAPS BECAUSE THE PEOPLE USED TO PACK THEIR THINGS NEATLY! MANY LOCAL PEOPLE USED TO WORK AT EITHER VICTORIA COLLIERY OR CHATTERLEY WHITFIELD. SOME WORKED AT THE LOCAL IRON WORKS. ALL THESE INDUSTRIES HAVE NOW CLOSED DOWN. BY MELANIE MARTIN AND KERRY LYNCH.
